results.title: Standing waves on transmission lines
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Radio Technician Training”.
By means of animated diagrams, laboratory demonstrations, and diverse analogies explains the causes, results, and prevention of standing waves in radio high frequency transmission lines.

results.title: Rectangular co-ordinates
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy and Loucks and Norling Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Radio Technician Training”.
Demonstrates how to use co-ordination in solving problems involving time and distance, and how to locate a point using two co-ordinates.

results.title: RCL: resistance, capacitance
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Radio Technician Training”.
Explains current and voltage in relation to time; voltage and current curves; the relationship of current and voltage; the measurement of voltage at source; the addition of phase components; and the effect of impedance on resonance.

results.title: Synchro systems. Part 1
results.creator_credit: United States. Navy. Bureau of Aeronautics and Burton Holmes Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Radio Technician Training”
Shows how orders from a ship’s telegraph on the bridge are transmitted electrically to a dial in the engine room. Discusses in detail the operations of the two major components in the system, the synchro generator and the synchro motor.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States. Navy. Bureau of Aeronautics and Burton Holmes Films

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Radio Technician Training”.
Demonstrates electron flow through a circuit, the charging and discharging of condensers, variations of a charge on a condenser in relation to time, and the behaviour of capacitance with alternating current.

results.title: Now or never
results.creator_credit: Linda Harrar, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Race to save the planet”.
The concluding episode of this series focuses on individuals and organisations who are fighting for the survival of the planet. It emphasises that whilst international treaties and organisations play a major role, individuals can also make a significant difference. The need for cooperation between all nations, rich and poor, has never been more urgent as “we need to make peace with each other in order to make peace with nature”. Narrated by Karina Kelly. A teacher’s guide accompanies the video.

results.title: Race to save the planet
results.creator_credit: John Angier, Carol Lynn Dornbrand, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: A series of programs on the global environmental crisis facing us all. Each program takes an in-depth look at the relationships between human society and the earth’s natural resources, focusing on solutions, constructive ideas and new approaches from all over the world. Each video is accompanied by teacher’s notes.

results.title: It needs political decisions
results.creator_credit: Vivian Ducat, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Race to save the planet”.
This program examines the role that governments can play in protecting the environment. In Zimbabwe, President Mugabe talks about the importance of education and of balancing people’s needs against those of the environment. In Thailand, as in Zimbabwe, population growth has been a major problem, and government birth control programs have played an important role in reducing this growth. Popular protest also plays a role in influencing governments, as in Sweden which now has a nuclear ban forced by the people, but care should also be taken that the political decisions made have taken every possible outcome into consideration. Narrated by Karina Kelly. A teacher’s book accompanies the video.
